Tic-Tac-Toe is a two-player game played on a 3x3 grid. Players take turns placing their mark, X or O, in an empty square. The first player to place three of their marks in a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal row wins the game. You will play as player 1, therefore you play with X while your adversary plays with the symbol O. Your input is then a number (from 0 to 2) for the row followed by a space and another number (from 0 to 2) for the column, nothing else. Do not output anything else but the row col values else you lose.
LLM's turn to guess.
Random wins by default due to LLM's repeated invalid moves.

Your input is then a number (from 0 to 2) for the row followed by a space and another number (from 0 to 2) for the column, nothing else. Do not output anything else but the row col values else you lose.
LLM's turn to guess.
Random wins by default due to LLM's repeated invalid moves.
